page.title: Tactics and Air Combat Defence Establishment

revision.text:
'''Tactics and Air Combat Defence Establishment''' or '''TACDE''' is an [[Indian Air Force]] unit for training aerial combat to its top one percent fighter pilots.<ref>http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-sukhois-set-for-gwalior-as-iaf-evolves-new-tactics-1407235</ref> TACDE is based in [[Gwalior]]. It was conferred Presidential standard in 2009.<ref>http://www.pib.nic.in/newsite/erelcontent.aspx?relid=53944</ref> The institution evolves tactical procedures for various aircraft, implement standard operating procedures and train pilots in operational doctrines. It is similar to [[United States Navy Strike Fighter Tactics Instructor program|Topgun]] of US Navy.
==History== TACDE was founded by Wing Commander A.K Mukherjee.<ref>http://indianairforce.nic.in/show_page.php?pg_id=85</ref> It was established in 1971 from previously formed Tactics and Combat Development and Training Squadron at [[Adampur]], [[Punjab]]. It got re-desginagted as TACDE on December 1972. The institutions has numerous awards and honors including [[Vir Chakra]] and [[Kirti Chakra]]. TACDE was awarded ‘Battle Honours’ by the President of India in 1995 for its role in the Indo-Pak conflict of 1971.<ref>http://www.pib.nic.in/newsite/erelcontent.aspx?relid=53944</ref>
==Inventory== *[[Mirage 2000]] *[[Sukhoi Su-30MKI]] *[[MIG 29]]
==Notable Alumni== *[[Pradeep Vasant Naik]] *[[Anil Yashwant Tipnis]] *[[Srinivasapuram Krishnaswamy]]
==See also== *[[College of Air Warfare]] *[[United States Navy Strike Fighter Tactics Instructor program]] *[[Vijeta]]- 1982 [[Bollywood]] movie
